headline: House GOP Asks Why Late Moscow Mayor’s Wife Not Sanctioned
author: NationalWatch
sentences: "Though Russian counter-sanctions were largely expected, the inclusion of Hunter Biden and, notably, none of the other Biden children among the list of those sanctioned raises serious concerns about why Russia would believe Hunter Biden is a pressure point to exploit?," the letter added.

(Ben Stansall/AFP/GettyImages)
By Eric Mack | Thursday, 21 April 2022 09:23 PM
The GOP's ranking member of the House Oversight Committee is asking why the wife of the former Moscow mayor is not being sanctioned amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

"Elena Baturina, a Russian billionaire who paid Hunter Biden $3 MILLION in 2014, is mysteriously missing from the Biden Admin's list of sanctioned Russian oligarchs," Rep. James Comer, the ranking member of the committee, tweeted Thursday.

The other House GOP members to sign to the letter were: Reps. Jody Hice, R-Ga.; Glenn Grothman, R-Wis.; Michael Cloud, R-Texas; Ralph Norman, R-S.C.; Nancy Mace, R-S.C.; Virginia Foxx, R-N.C.; Bob Gibbs, R-Ohio; Clay Higgins, R-La.

It asked whether Baturina is "being treated differently" than other "wealthy, politically connected Russians" amid sanctions hitting oligarchs for Vladimir Putin's invasion of Ukraine because of her reported ties to Hunter Biden.
?the United States is avoiding sanctioning certain Russian oligarchs because of concerns they may attempt to influence American policy by exploiting Hunter Biden's connection with his father?
The allegations of Baturina's payment to Hunter Biden is tied to the ongoing laptop scandal that has revealed multi-million dollar foreign business dealings with Russia, Ukraine and China.
; Pete Sessions, R-Texas; Fred Keller, R-Pa; Andrew Clyde, R-Ga.; Scott Franklin, R-Fla.; Jake LaTurner, R-Kan.; Pat Fallon, R-Texas; Yvette Herrell, R-N.M.; and Byron Donalds, R-Fla.
The Hunter Biden-tied business Rosemont Seneca Thornton reportedly received a $3.5 million wire in 2014 from Baturina, who was the wife of late mayor of Moscow Yuri Luzhkov.
"We request further information to determine whether Hunter Biden's relationships with Russian oligarchs are impacting the foreign policy decisions of the United States."
Comer's Thursday tweet added a photo of a letter to Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen, seeking answers to questions about Hunter Biden's "foreign business schemes."
"?Because Hunter Biden is now subject to sanctions issued by Russia, his foreign business dealings are of heightened importance?," the letter continued.
That was the year Russia annexed the Crimean Peninsula under former President Barack Obama, when Joe Biden was vice president.
House GOP Asks Why Late Moscow Mayor's Wife Not Sanctioned Elena Baturina in Trafalgar Square, London, on September 19, 2012.
"@GOPoversight is asking @SecYellen: do Hunter Biden's foreign benefactors get a free pass from scrutiny?"
There were 18 other House GOP members who signed the letter seeking answers from Yellen.
Reps. Jim Jordan, R-Ohio, and Andy Biggs, R-Ariz., were among the letter's signatories.
— the American people deserve to know it?," the letter to Yellen read.
— the president of the United States?
